doc.after: Beryllium hydroxide Be(OH)2 is amphoteric.[16] The hydroxide itself is insoluble in water, with a solubility product logÂ K*sp of â11.7. Addition of acid gives soluble hydrolysis products, including the trimeric ion [Be3(OH)3(H2O)6]3+, which has OH groups bridging between pairs of beryllium ions making a 6-membered ring.[17] At very low pH the aqua ion [Be(H2O)4]2+ is formed. Addition of hydroxide to Be(OH)2 gives the soluble tetrahydroxo anion [Be(OH)4]2â.
